A collection of utility methods for JTable.

TableUtils

public TableUtils()
Method Detail

saveSelection

public static int[] saveSelection(javax.swing.JTable table)
Save the selection of the JTable as an array of integer. It works for all cases either row selection is allowed or column selection or cell selection is allowed. However you cannot change the row/column selection allowed attribute between saveSelection and loadSelection.

Parameters:
table -
Returns:
selection as an array

loadSelection

public static void loadSelection(javax.swing.JTable table,
                                 int[] selected)
Restore the selection in JTable. It must used the array that created by saveSelection.

Parameters:
table -
selected - an int array created by saveSelection

getTablePreference

public static java.lang.String getTablePreference(javax.swing.JTable table)
Gets the table preference string. The preference string contains the information such as each table column width and column order. If the table column width or order is changed after getTablePreference is called, setTablePreference() will change table column width and order to the previous state when is preference string is saved.

Parameters:
table -
Returns:
table preference string.

setTablePreference

public static void setTablePreference(javax.swing.JTable table,
                                      java.lang.String pref)
Sets the table preference string that was saved before to the table.

Parameters:
table -
pref - the preference string. If the value is null or if the string is not saved from the table as specified in table parameter, this method will simply return and won't change the table at all.

synchonizeTableRowSelection

public static void synchonizeTableRowSelection(javax.swing.JTable master,
                                               javax.swing.JTable slave)
Makes the master table and slave table using the same SelectionModel so that when any selection change in master table will be reflected in slave table too.

Parameters:
master -
slave -

synchonizeTableColumnSelection

public static void synchonizeTableColumnSelection(javax.swing.JTable master,
                                                  javax.swing.JTable slave)
Makes the master table and slave table using the same SelectionModel so that when any selection change in master table will be reflected in slave table too.

Parameters:
master -
slave -

synchonizeTables

public static void synchonizeTables(javax.swing.JTable[] tables)
Links the tables in the table array so that they look like one table. The things this method actually did is smoothing key navigation (tab or array key will navigate across the table, maintaining only one sorting column if those are SortableTable, synchonizing the row selection.

Parameters:
tables -

nextRow
